title: I had enough of technology skins...
body:
Just saw the PBE to see yet another mecha skin line. It is just overdose this season. I just can't even tell the difference apart from them since they are too much of them. Can we have more magical, fantasy related skinlines? If I wanted more Gundams, I would play Gundam instead of lol.

Say, elderwood, guardian of the sands, gothic, celtic themes would do great.

replies.body: Holy shit, I just finished to write a post about this and then I read yours :< . I completely agree with you, enough with robots. Elderwood would be a really cool theme if they expanded it. Personally I would love to see some Incas or Mayas skinline, I feel like worldbreaker is a bit meh.
Elderwood Nami would have been great, a massive wave of leaves? And as it travelled it was a rustling leaves sound?
Does a plant theme really make sense for a champion with mermaid physique?
Does a giant living tree in a catsuit make sense?

Of course it makes sense, he is a cat tree.
https://secure.img2-ag.wfcdn.com/im/39807699/compr-r85/4107/41075835/106-cat-tree.jpg
¯\\\_(ツ)_/¯

______________

Seriously now, that Nyankai skin is obviously a joke skin, so it is intended to be silly.
But an Elderwood Nami skin would most likely be a serious skin, not made just for jokes and giggles.

If they add champions to these skin lines, it should make sense thematically. The only way I could imagine that to work out for Nami is that she is some forest lake spirit, but that would still have more a water thematic than a plant thematic and it is already kinda occupied by her River Spirit skin.

Not saying it is impossible, but I think it is kinda hard to implement Nami in that skin line while making it feel natural and thematically fitting.

I can understand that but it's so out there which is why it's unique. Else you are kinda gating her off to just water based skins. This Programme skin is at least an attempt to give her a skin not water/fish themed.

Elderwood and Conqueror of the Sands are both skin lines I'd be open to see on Nami.
Yes, why not! I imagined a wave of roots and leaves

Battlecast: Giant **monster** robots.
Super Galaxy: **Pilots** riding Robots, they are like Power Rangers with Megazords. 
Project: **Cyborgs**, humans with robot parts.
Mecha: Giant **Bipedal** Robots that can **transform into vehicles**
Pulsefire: This one is hard but: **Humans wearing clothes** that are a mix between old fashion and high tech.

(The words in **bold** are the main difference between each skinline)

I would add that the colors and sounds are truly different too.

Battlecast skins are red/black. It looks like something heavy, strong and dangerous.
The Super Galaxy instead play on anime vibes, with flash, light and anime sound referencing those anime.
For Project, it's clearly the cyberpunk theme which is done, with distinct colors for each of them, plus there metal looks lighter.
Mecha have some effects which clearly tend to the Transformers style. They look like solid robot made for duel fight.
And finally Pulsefire, which is white clean with some leather mixed to the armor. The only pure white technology skinline we have right now.

Honestly, you can say what you want, but not being able to differenciate those skinline (plus Eternum, Program, Praetorian) while being able to differenciate the mages skinline, is bad faith...

When Illaoi had the skin thing going on where people could vote for the theme, people voted for Battlecast over two other non-robot themes, space and explorer. That's not to say we aren't lacking in some particular skin fantasies (anything high fantasy imo) but I would say it isn't exactly niche among the player base.

That contest's result was highly questionable as everybody and their mother could just open up their smurfs to rig the vote and there was 0 effort to stop this kind of endeavour.

We have no idea how many people were engaged in that kind of practice during the event, but it is in no doubt that there were indeed some individuals who utilised it to their advantage; if there's any opportunity to do shitty things, there will always be assholes there to abuse it.

The result probably only shows which faction has the most smurfs and/or has the most tendency to take the means of election rigging when presented the chance, rather than proving the actual general preference of the community.

And even if the tech skin crowd is the majority, it still doesn't change the fact any smart company wouldn't go out of their way to supremely under-serve the minority demand while insisting on overserving the otherwise, while also falsely assuming that the demand trend is completely static and never shifting.

Even for mecha skins, how about "antique, utopian, prosperous" for a change?  Like out of place artifacts, or even better stuff like Da Vinci might invent, I want a intricate, yet beautiful collectors skin rather than these rustbuckets of zero value aside from blasting off their heads.

Just to say, C-3PO is one of my favorite characters in culture. A shiny golden robot butler handmade from a millions of parts. It is something you want. i don't want any more cheap battle droids.

While the Project, Program, and I assume Praetorian all share the same dystopian future that is basically the cyberpunk theme they were going for, the others don't.

Yeah super galaxy is future, but its heavily influenced by shonen anime.  Specifically Gurren Lagann in Rumble's who is a walking love letter to that show.  And while admittedly the setting in the beginning isn't very bright, it is definitely a good triumphs over evil story.

Mecha and Battlecast are just giant robots with distinct styles, nothing super fancy, but they aren't meant to be.

Besides your desire for "beautiful collectors skins" isn't really feasible.  Usually mechs and robots are made with function over form in mind, even when the design is aesthetically pleasing they still tend towards being functional over works of art.  Seeing as any skin meant to be mechanical or robotic in nature would most likely be geared toward fighting, artistic value is a weakness.

Also in perspective, only the inner workings of C-3PO is made from scavenged parts.  The outer golden shell was added when became the protocol droid of Padme.  So honestly unless you know his backstory you just see a shiny golden robot.  Which is actually cliche and boring.

Seriously don't contradict yourself, it makes it harder for people to take you seriously.  Having said that I probably did that somewhere, but if so I am blaming that on be tired.
